channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023120514
item.description:
Report X-2023120514

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the GSOH facility. The fiberboard box contained a steel drum inside and the cap on top of the drum was loose. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2023120097
item.description:
Report E-2023120097

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-cup spill of regulated UN2491 "Ethanolamine" that was released at Terminal NCH. (1) 55-gallon metal drum was damaged from a pinhole puncture that came from its pallet impacting the dock. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was decided it would be cleaned with PPE on hand. (1) 95-gallon poly drum overpack containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, damaged metal drum, the remaining material, and the issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found on the dock to have extra packing tape going around the package. The box seemed to be wet prior to these findings. DescribePack: One of the glass bottles cracked and shattered from it being dropped/mishandled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed up right and to the cage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the 300 belt, package was wet and was taken off belt and brought to QA area. DescribePack: Two caps were loose and damaged causing contents to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to QA area, as to mitigate any further damage.

item.title: Report X-2023120120
item.description:
Report X-2023120120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to us from the IC belt manager because it was wet on the side and bottom of package. We inspected the box and found 2 of the 4 caps were loose and the contents spilled out and contaminated all 4 of the bottles. We made sure to place these in a lined hazmat tote and moved it to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 2 loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package in a lined hazmat tote and moved this to the hazmat cage. We also made sure this didn't effect any other packages on the IC belt.

item.title: Report X-2023120063
item.description:
Report X-2023120063

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the paper bag containing the caustic soda beads was ripped causing the contents to spill. The box containing the bag was too large allowing the item to move about in transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023120034

Report X-2023120034

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Belt manager called QA over about a potential leaking hazmat package. Upon inspection we found a loose cap on 1 of the bottles of cleaning solution. No other packages were affected by this leaking package. We put this package in a lined tote and placed in hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Repsonded quickly and isolated package to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120032
item.description:
Report X-2023120032

  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IC belt manager called QA on the radio to come and inspect a possible leaking hazmat. Upon inspection we found a loose cap on 1 of the 4 bottles of Condenser Coil Cleaner. Made sure that this hazmat didnt leak on any other boxes. We then put the box in a lined hazmat tote and isolated this in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Responded quickly and made sure to move the hazmat to the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager in QA brought the hazmat in a lined black tote and communicated was found under a belt. DescribePack: The front side of the box was wet from loose caps leaking gave off a bad smell. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Second that the box was discovered our QA manager immediately placed in a lined tote, still gave off a very bad smell. Placed the leaking contents under the hood vent in our hazmat cage for processing.

  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to us by the van line manager because of a bad smell. We discovered the can was bent/slightly crushed and all of the liquid had spilled out. The manager already had this in a tote but we made sure to secure this leaking package in a lined hazmat tote and moved to the hazmat cage, then placed it under the air vent. DescribePack: The lid was bent on top of the can DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure to place this in a lined hazmat tote and went to the area where the manager discovered the leaking package to clean up the liquid on the ground.

DescribePack: the caps of all four inner bottles were loose. The top of the outer packaging was damp. DescribePack: 2 jugs had loose caps/broken seals and were dented near the top of the neck. The outer packaging was soaked on the top side. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red hazmat tote and taken to the nearest QA cage for further processing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WE WERE CALLED TO THE IC BELT BY THE MANAGER BECAUSE OF A LEAKING PAIL. WE ARRIVED QUICKLY AND DISCOVERED A SMALL LEAK IN THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL. WE ISOLATED THIS PAIL IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MADE SURE TO GET THIS INTO THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: 1/4" HOLE ON BOTTOM OF PAIL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE PUT THIS IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED IT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE.

We went over to inspect and discovered 1 gallon of this product spilled all of its contents inside of the package, contaminating the entire package. We isolated this package and moved to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moved the package into the hazmat cage after placing it into a lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023110690
item.description:
Report X-2023110690

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The events that lead to the actual damage of the package are unknown, but once package was discovered immediate action was taken to isolate the package in the Hazmat processing cage, where it could be further looked over and investigated. DescribePack: Package contained four one gallon bottles of corrosive liquid. One bottle had a broken safety seal on the bottle, which caused it to leak out into the carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once discovered, immediate action was taken to isolate the package in the Hazmat processing cage, away from the general area. Once inside the hazmat processing cage, the package was further looked over and processed thoroughly.
